description: Punjab Congress MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira asserted that the 1984 anti-Sikh violence was not riots but a Sikh genocide, and justice continues to elude the victims after 40 years.
title: In 1984, it wasn't a 'riot' but a Sikh genocide: Congress MLA Khaira

description: Recent clashes between pro-Khalistan and Hindu groups in Canada are causing fear among Indian immigrants, particularly those from Punjab.  Many worry that the violence will damage their reputation, jeopardize visa applications, and strain community relations. Families back in India are also expressing concern for their loved ones' safety and urging both Canadian and Indian authorities to intervene.
title: Canada clashes scare Punjabis abroad, kin pray for safety

description: The video of the moment when Moo Deng picked Donald Trump over Kamala Harris was filmed Monday -- a day before Election Day -- at the Khao Khewo Open Zoo in Chonburi, eastern Thailand. Moo Deng was called out of the water for the crucial test. The other hippo with Moo Deng picked Kamala Harris.
title: Watch: Viral Moo Deng predicts Trump will win US election 2024

description: Pro-Khalistan separatists attacked a Hindu temple and disrupted Indian consular activities in Brampton, Canada. Prime Minister Modi condemned the violence and urged Canadian authorities to ensure justice.  The incident has raised concerns about the safety of Indian nationals and the space given to separatist groups in Canada.
title: Canada cops pinning down Hindu youth likened to George Floyd case

description: India is demanding the extradition of Sandeep Singh Sidhu, a Canadian Border Security Agency employee, for his alleged involvement in the 2020 assassination of Shaurya Chakra awardee Balwinder Singh Sandhu.  Indian authorities claim Sidhu masterminded the killing from Canada in coordination with Pakistan's ISI and hired assassins who gunned down Sandhu at his Punjab residence.
title: Punjab murder plotter a Canada agency staffer?
Ajit Ranade steps down as vice chancellor of Gokhale Institute

description: A farmer named Munna Lal has sparked controversy by claiming ownership of a portion of Agra's Gyarah Sidi Park, citing a decades-long legal battle and court orders.  Lal's actions, including fencing off the disputed land, have disrupted the Agra Development Authority's plans to transform the park into a vibrant cultural and entertainment hub.
title: Farmer claims park with Taj view, raises fences

description: Tragedy struck in Uttarakhand as a bus carrying 63 passengers plunged into a 200-meter gorge, claiming the lives of 36 people and injuring 27 others. The overloaded bus, en route from Naini Danda to Ramnagar, lost control near Sarad Bend. Prime Minister Modi and other officials expressed condolences, announcing financial aid for the victims' families.
title: 36 killed, 27 injured as bus falls into gorge in Almora

description: The Supreme Court has urged the Indian government to make a decision on the mercy plea of Balwant Singh Rajoana, convicted in the assassination of former Punjab Chief Minister Beant Singh. Rajoana has been imprisoned for 29 years, with his mercy plea pending for 12.
title: Act on Rajoana’s mercy petition or we’ll decide on commutation: SC to govt

description: Maharashtra's Director General of Police (DGP), Rashmi Shukla, has been transferred out of her position amidst accusations of bias against opposition parties. The Election Commission's decision follows multiple complaints from the Congress party, citing concerns about Shukla's impartiality in conducting free and fair assembly elections.
title: Keen to rule out bias, EC shifts DGP; poll panel wants top officers to be seen as non-partisan

description: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Delhi government and police seeking an explanation for the non-compliance with its firecracker ban order during Diwali. The court highlighted the alarming air pollution levels in the city and indicated a potential year-round ban on firecrackers in the National Capital Region (NCR) to combat the issue.
title: Toxic smog hangs over city, more stations turn ‘severe’

description: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Delhi government and police seeking an explanation for the widespread bursting of firecrackers on Diwali despite a ban. The court, expressing concern over the violation of its order and the resulting air pollution, has suggested a year-round ban on firecrackers in the National Capital Region and proposed stringent measures for enforcement.
title: How was cracker ban flouted? SC notice to Delhi government, police

description: Pakistan's parliament has approved a bill extending the tenure of the army, navy, and air force chiefs from three to five years. The move, passed amidst opposition protests, is seen as a setback for former Prime Minister Imran Khan, who has accused the military of orchestrating his removal from office.
title: In a blow to Imran, Pak parl enacts law hiking services chiefs’ term from 3 to 5 years

description: As the US gears up for the 2024 presidential election, the potential return of Republican nominee Donald Trump has significant implications for India. Trump's commitment to strengthening the India-US bilateral ties, particularly in trade, defense, and counter-terrorism, could reshape the geopolitical landscape and present both opportunities and challenges for India.
title: Second term for Trump? What it could mean for India-US relations

description: Lahore, Pakistan, experienced hazardous levels of air pollution for two consecutive days, ranking as the second most polluted city globally. The Punjab government attributed the pollution to winds carrying pollutants from India, specifically Amritsar and Chandigarh.  They called for dialogue and cooperation between both countries to address the transboundary smog issue effectively.
title: Lahore chokes in pollution for 2nd day, Pak Punjab govt blames it on winds from India

description: The inaugural J&K assembly session witnessed chaos as PDP MLA Waheed Para introduced a resolution challenging Article 370's abrogation. BJP members vehemently opposed it, leading to heated exchanges.  LG Manoj Sinha, in his address, lauded the peaceful elections and assured efforts for the restoration of statehood.
title: Bedlam in J&K assembly’s first session as PDP MLA moves resolution on Art 370

description: In a significant step towards easing border tensions, Indian Army patrols have resumed at multiple patrolling points in the Depsang Plains region of eastern Ladakh. This development follows a recent agreement with China to disengage troops. Despite the harsh winter conditions, the Indian Army is committed to asserting its patrolling rights in the area.
title: After Demchok, Army undertakes first full-fledged patrol in Depsang

description: Former Canadian minister Ujjal Dosanjh has criticized Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's handling of Sikh extremism in Canada, calling his approach 'idiotic' for prioritizing identity politics over shared Canadian values.
title: 'Trudeau an idiot': Ex-Canadian minister Ujjal Dosanjh

description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris faced off in a tightly contested US presidential election. Trump, seeking a second term, campaigned on a platform of strength and nationalism, while Harris pledged to protect democracy and unite the country. With polls showing a dead heat, both sides expressed confidence in their paths to victory.
title: A toxic Tuesday in offing as a divided US goes to polls

description: Vice President Kamala Harris chose Howard University, her alma mater and a historically Black institution, to host her election night watch party.  The choice reflects a return to her roots, influenced by family friend Ajit Singh who also attended Howard.  Harris' journey from Howard to the Senate mirrors her early exposure to politics and activism.
title: 'Black Harvard' on cusp of giving its first US president

description: Here’s a look at the top 5 stories making waves across Hollywood and Bollywood, highlighting today’s must-know headlines everyone is buzzing about. From Simi Garewal standing up for Abhishek Bachchan amidst rumors of his divorce from Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and speculations linking him to Nimrat Kaur, to the sad news of Mithun Chakraborty’s first wife, Helena Luke, passing away in the US, and Singham Again smashing records with its opening weekend collection. Here are today’s top 5 entertainment news highlights.
title: Top 5 entertainment news

description: A recent survey reveals a growing trend of Indian parents, especially in urban areas, choosing private schools over government schools for their children's primary education. While government schools still hold the majority nationally, urban areas show a marked preference for private institutions, driven by perceptions of better quality, facilities, and a wider range of educational choices.
title: What makes urban parents turn to private schools?

description: The upcoming US presidential election is seeing unprecedented security measures due to concerns over potential violence and misinformation. Election officials are increasing security at polling places and working to counter false information spreading online. Public trust in the election process is low, raising concerns about voter turnout and potential unrest.
title: Drones, GPS tracking, snipers: US officials brace for high-risk Election Day

description: A protest organized by the Coalition of Hindus of North America (CoHNA) against the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada turned chaotic as the Royal Canadian Mounted Police officers were filmed allegedly assaulting the Hindu worshippers.
title: Outrage over video showing Canadian cops 'assaulting' Hindus

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed two rallies in Jharkhand. He accused the JMM-led government of supporting infiltrators and disrespecting tribal leaders. Modi highlighted BJP's commitment to tribal welfare and criticized Congress for its alleged role in tribal oppression. He also condemned the opposition's silence on derogatory remarks against women leaders.
title: 'Mothers, daughters in shock': PM Modi attacks oppn over 'maal'-icious remark

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has publicly condemned the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada, characterizing it as a calculated act. He also criticized the Canadian government's response, alleging attempts to intimidate Indian diplomats. This follows India's withdrawal of diplomats amidst accusations of violence against Sikh separatist figures in Canada.
title: 'Deliberate … cowardly': PM Modi's first reaction on India-Canada tensions, temple attack

description: Shalini Kapoor Sagar, a close friend of Alice Kaushik and Kanwar Dhillon, defends Dhillon amidst criticism over his clarification of Kaushik's comments about their relationship. Sagar highlights their strong bond and expresses sadness over public scrutiny, emphasizing that only the couple truly understands their situation.
title: Shalini Sagar backs Kanwar Dhillon on the marriage controversy with Alice Kaushik

description: Kaustubh Shakkarwar, an LLM student at OP Jindal Global University, is suing the institution after being accused of using AI on an exam and failing.
title: Student sues OP Jindal School after it fails him over 'AI-generated' answers

description: Bank Fixed Deposits (FDs) are offering attractive interest rates, making it a favorable time for investors to lock in high returns before potential rate cuts by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). The ET Intelligence Group has identified the top-performing bank FDs across various tenures, providing investors with insights to maximize their returns in a potentially declining interest rate environment.
title: Top 5 Bank FDs: Best FDs for 1, 2, 3 and 5-year time period? Check list

description: Cognizant is experiencing a resurgence, welcoming back nearly 13,000 former employees due to renewed growth and stability.
title: Cognizant CEO on rejoining of 13K associates: 'The mojo of the company is back'

description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is facing a Lokayukta investigation into a land allocation scheme by the Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA). The scheme, which involved allotting developed land to individuals who surrendered undeveloped land, is alleged to have benefited Siddaramaiah's wife, Parvathi, during his previous term.
title: Muda case: Lokayukta summons K'taka CM Siddaramaiah on Nov 6

description: A MiG-29 fighter jet, piloted by Wing Commander Manish Mishra, crashed in agricultural fields near Agra following a technical malfunction during a routine training exercise. The pilot ejected safely and sustained no injuries. An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the crash.
title: IAF's MiG-29 fighter jet crashes near Agra, pilot ejects safely

description: The Election Commission of India has delayed bypolls for nine Uttar Pradesh assembly seats from November 13th to November 20th, citing festival considerations.  This decision has drawn criticism from Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, who accused the ruling BJP of attempting to influence the election results by capitalizing on the revised date and potentially disenfranchising migrant workers returning for Diwali.
title: 'BJP was never so weak': Akhilesh Yadav on UP bypolls date change

description: India's cricket team faces scrutiny after a demoralizing series loss to New Zealand at home.  With a challenging tour of Australia looming, Sunil Gavaskar criticized India's recent preparation strategies, particularly the focus on spin-friendly pitches and the cancellation of a warm-up match in Australia, emphasizing the importance of acclimatizing to conditions Down Under.
title: Australia tour a huge mountain to climb: Gavaskar

description: Pakistan-linked hacking group Transparent Tribe is escalating its cyber espionage campaign against Indian entities.  The group is using a sophisticated malware called ElizaRAT, which has evolved to include enhanced evasion techniques and advanced command and control capabilities, often leveraging legitimate cloud services for disguise.
title: How Pakistani hackers are using ElizaRAT ‘virus’ to target India

description: India's batting crumbled against spin in their recent 3-0 Test series loss to New Zealand. The hosts, aiming to exploit spin-friendly conditions, were undone by their own vulnerability, with even experienced batters like Virat Kohli struggling.  The defeat jeopardizes India's World Test Championship Final hopes, requiring them to win four matches in the upcoming series against Australia.
title: A 'smackers' game now: KP says only way to play spin is...

description: Former President Donald Trump is gaining unexpected support among Arab and Muslim-Americans, a demographic that traditionally leaned Democratic. Dissatisfaction with the Biden administration's Middle East policies, especially regarding the Israel-Palestine conflict, has led to this shift. This trend could significantly impact swing states like Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Arizona in the upcoming closely contested election.
title: Will 'revenge voting' from Muslim-Americans help Trump win US polls?

description: A viral video shows devotees at Banke Bihari temple in Vrindavan drinking air conditioner water, mistaking it for holy water. Health experts warn against consuming such water, highlighting risks including Legionnaires' disease and other infections. AC water can harbor harmful microbes, contaminants, and heavy metals, making it unsafe for drinking or even plant irrigation.
title: Watch: People drink AC water assuming it to be Lord Krishna's charanamrit;
Top Hezbollah commander Abu Ali Rida 'eliminated' in air strike, says Israel

description: Four children, aged 2 to 7, tragically died from suffocation inside a locked car in Randhiya village, Gujarat. Left unattended while their parents worked at a nearby farm, the children entered the car owner's vehicle and became trapped. Their bodies were discovered later that evening, leading to an investigation by the Amreli police.
title: 4 children get locked in car, die of suffocation in Gujarat's Amreli

description: Mukesh Ambani is aiming to list Reliance Jio on the stock market by 2025, with analysts valuing the company at over $100 billion. The retail division's IPO is expected later due to operational matters.
title: Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Jio IPO set to debut on stock market in 2025
Why EC has deferred bypolls in UP, Kerala and Punjab
'I have been framed': RG Kar rape accused Sanjay Roy; trial to begin Nov 11
Army plane crashes near Agra, pilot ejects safely
'Deeply concerned': India condemns violence by 'extremists' at Hindu temple in Canada

description: BB Tyagi joined AAP. Tyagi is a former BJP municipal councillor. He was also the chairman of the East Delhi Municipal Corporation. He contested the 2015 assembly elections on a BJP ticket.  Tyagi joined AAP in the presence of Manish Sisodia. Delhi Assembly elections are expected in February next year.
title: BJP leader BB Tyagi joins AAP ahead of Delhi assembly polls

description: After a nine-month delay, the Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) released its recruitment notification, sparking frustration among aspirants. The delay, attributed to the election code of conduct, has rendered thousands ineligible due to exceeding the age limit. Candidates are demanding a two-year age limit extension.
title: MPSC employment notice delay disqualifies more than 50K aspirants

description: US elections' impact on Indian stock markets: Analysts predict a Trump win could significantly impact global markets, while a Kamala Harris win might maintain current economic conditions.  Experts suggest India could benefit from a Trump presidency due to its domestic consumption-driven economy and potential advantages from altered global trade dynamics.
title: What would a Trump or Harris victory mean for Indian markets?

description: Ravindra Jadeja roared back to 'wicket-taking' form with a brilliant ten-wicket haul in the Mumbai Test against New Zealand. This timely return to form, coupled with his consistent batting contributions in 2024, makes him a key player for India as they prepare to face Australia in the crucial Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
title: Is Jadeja back to his wicket-taking best ahead of BGT?

description: The Supreme Court has issued notices to the Delhi government and police, demanding an explanation for the ineffective enforcement of the Diwali firecracker ban. The court highlighted the severe pollution levels in the city, surpassing even the previous two years, and requested detailed reports on the measures taken to implement the ban and curb stubble burning in neighboring states.
title: 'Ban on firecrackers hardly implemented': SC sends notice to Delhi police, govt

description: Donald Trump ends his rallies with the 1978 disco hit 'YMCA,' using it as a campaign anthem. This choice resonates with his supporters, despite its origins in LGBT culture. Victor Willis of the Village People has dropped objections to the song's use, acknowledging its popularity boost. The song's nostalgia appeals to Trump's base, tapping into a youthful spirit.
title: US Elections: Why 'YMCA' became a staple in Trump's MAGA rally

description: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal clarified a recent incident where mislabeled mushrooms were found at a Hyperpure warehouse, emphasizing that the issue was a minor vendor error caught internally and the warehouse received an A+ rating from FSSAI.
title: Zomato warehouse raided: CEO Deepinder Goyal says, 'just want to clarify ...'

description: ​In recent months, betting markets are leaning in in favour of Trump, with odds on various platforms such as BetOnline, Betfair, Bovada, and others placing him as the frontrunner. On average, these betting platforms suggest a 54.3% probability of Trump winning versus 44.4% for Harris. This reflects a consistent edge for Trump across platforms, signalling that many bettors believe he holds a slight yet reliable advantage.
title: US Election 2024: Betting markets bet big on Trump before Nov 5

description: India's supercar market is experiencing unprecedented growth, with sales projected to reach 1,200-1,300 units in 2024.  This surge is driven by a booming economy, rising disposable incomes, and a growing cultural acceptance of supercars as status symbols.  Leading brands like Audi, Porsche, BMW, and Mercedes-Benz are reporting record sales, fueled by high demand for their high-performance models.
title: Poster dreams to reality: Why India's supercar sales are soaring?

description: Iran plans a more destructive offensive against Israel after recent Israeli strikes on Iranian military facilities. Iran may use missiles with more powerful warheads and involve conventional forces. Senior Iranian officials have indicated the possibility of producing nuclear weapons if faced with an existential threat.
title: Iran plans to use 'more powerful weapons' against Israel: Report

description: India's recent Test series whitewash against New Zealand has put head coach Gautam Gambhir under scrutiny. Despite a successful IPL coaching stint, Gambhir's decisions, particularly regarding turning pitches, backfired. While some experts believe it's too early to judge, his performance is being compared to predecessors Ravi Shastri and Rahul Dravid.
title: Is it too early to judge Gambhir despite a historic low?

description: The Election Commission has transferred Maharashtra DGP Rashmi Shukla following Congress' complaint of bias against the opposition in the upcoming elections. The chief secretary must now appoint a new DGP. Congress cited increased political violence and Shukla's alleged partiality and previous misconduct as reasons for her removal, seeking fair conduct during the election period.
title: EC transfers Maharashtra DGP Rashmi Shukla after opposition's 'bias' claims

description: Mithun Chakraborty was married to Helena Luke for four months. The actress passed away in the US and while the reason for her death is still unknown, her last post read that she was feeling weird with mixed emotions and discombobulated!
title: Mithun Chakraborty's first wife Helena Luke passes away in the US

description: Chhath Puja, prominent in Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, and West Bengal, honors Lord Surya. The rituals span four days: Nahaye Khaye involves spiritual purification, Kharna includes a Nirjala fast, Sandhya Arghya features an evening offering to the Sun God, and Usha Arghya concludes with prayers to the rising Sun and breaking the fast.
title: Chhath Puja 2024: When is Chhath Puja? Know Date and Significance

description: India will face South Africa in a four-match T20 series starting November 8, aiming to extend their winning streak against the Proteas. The rivalry between the two nations has produced thrilling encounters, including India's recent World Cup victory, a match significantly impacted by Suryakumar Yadav's exceptional catch. The rivalry has showcased the adaptability of both teams.
title: Can Suryakumar Yadav-led India maintain their T20I dominance in SA?
China's marriage registrations fall by almost a million in 2024
How much do King Charles and Prince William make from charities?

description: Bank Holidays November 2024: Indian banks will observe 13 holidays in November 2024, impacting various states due to Diwali, Chhath Puja, Guru Nanak Jayanti, and regional festivals. Despite the closures, customers can utilize online and mobile banking services for uninterrupted access to their accounts.
title: Bank Holidays November 2024: Banks closed for up to 13 days

description: After BJP denied Gopal Shetty a ticket, the ex-MP filed as an independent from Borivali, citing neglect of local workers. Intense lobbying by BJP leaders, including meetings with Dy CM Devendra Fadnavis and hints of Amit Shah's involvement, led to Shetty's withdrawal from the race.
title: BJP leader Gopal Shetty withdraws candidature as independent from Borivali

description: A Thane resident has praised Google's 'Take Flyover' feature on LinkedIn, urging the company to reward its creator with a Diwali bonus. The feature's 3D landmark and point-of-interest presentations have received wide approval from users.
title: 'Google, better give Diwali bonus to the person who ...,' says viral LinkedIn post

description: Satellite imagery analysis reveals that five decades of unplanned urbanization in Bengaluru choked natural drainage networks, leading to severe flooding in North Bengaluru on October 22, 2024.  The study, using images dating back to 1973, shows the disappearance of crucial waterways under concrete, leaving rainwater with nowhere to drain during heavy downpours.
title: Decades of urbanization lead to catastrophic flooding in Bengaluru, satellite data reveals

description: Villagers killed a tiger in retaliation for mauling a man near Ranthambore National Park. The forest department's monitoring gaps were highlighted, and concerns were raised about potential trends in tiger lynching. Compensation was negotiated for the deceased's family, and measures are being considered to prevent future human-animal conflicts.
title: Villagers beat tiger to death after it kills man in Ranthambore

description: Coming back to the movie's business, a report in Sacnilk.com stated that the Kartik Aaryan starrer has earned Rs 104.50 crore in its first three days, with Rs 32 crore on the third day, according to early estimates. Surprisingly, the film saw a slight drop in earnings on Sunday, even though it was a holiday. The second day's collection was Rs 37 crore, and it opened with Rs 35.5 crore.
title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 OTT release: Kartik's film to release on this streaming platform

description: A man in South Australia was hospitalized due to lead poisoning after consuming Kamini tablets. These tablets, marketed for boosting vigor and vitality, contain high levels of lead and mercury. Both metals are highly toxic and pose serious health risks. This incident has prompted the Australian government to issue safety alerts for such medications.
title: Man hospitalised after consuming Kamini tablets: Side effects one must know

description: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange announces that he will not endorse any candidates or political parties in the upcoming Maharashtra assembly elections. He urges the Maratha community to decide independently and hold candidates accountable for their stance on Maratha reservations. Jarange emphasizes the community's strength and his ongoing fight for their reservation under the OBC category.
title: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange takes U-turn, says won't back any party

description: Bosch is planning to lay off 7,000 employees in Germany, mainly in the automotive supply sector, tools division, and BSH subsidiary. Despite aiming for a major acquisition of Johnson Controls worth $8 billion to boost its position in the heat pump and air conditioning industry, Bosch will not achieve its 2024 economic goals.
title: Bosch to cut 7,000 jobs: "At the moment, I cannot rule out ...," says CEO

description: In Taatiparru village of Andhra Pradesh, four young men died due to electrocution while preparing for a statue inauguration. A fifth person is hospitalized. The victims, involved in setting up banners, include Bolla Veerraju, Pamarthi Nagendra, Marishetti Manikantha, and Kasagani Krishna. The incident occurred on Sunday, and their bodies are sent for autopsy.
title: Andhra Pradesh: 4 die of electrocution during statue installation

description: After India's 0-3 series loss to New Zealand at home, Michael Vaughan and Wasim Akram suggested a Test series between India and Pakistan, noting the potential excitement. Vaughan believes Pakistan can beat India on spin-friendly pitches, supported by their recent series win against England. Fans and experts are eagerly discussing this possibility.
title: 'Pakistan can beat India …': Wasim Akram's big statement

description: Three men were arrested for attacking a school bus with 28 children in Amroha. They fired shots and threw bricks at the bus to target the driver. The incident followed an earlier altercation between the driver and the main accused. The suspects were apprehended with weapons after evaluating 150 CCTV cameras.
title: 3 men held in UP for firing at school bus carrying 28 kids to 'get even with driver'

description: The Border Gavaskar Trophy's upcoming edition will commence on November 22 with a five-Test series in Perth. Australia aims to reclaim the trophy from India, who face a challenge after a recent 0-3 series loss to New Zealand and debates around Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli’s Test careers after their poor run of form.
title: Six Indian legends ended theirTest career in Border Gavaskar Trophy

description: State Bank of India (SBI) warns its customers about fraudulent SMS and WhatsApp messages related to SBI Reward points. The bank clarifies it never sends such messages and advises users against clicking suspicious links. The fake messages prompt customers to redeem reward points and could lead to potential scams.
title: SBI customers, these SMS & WhatsApp messages on rewards points are fake

description: India condemns a violent attack by alleged Sikh extremists on Hindu Sabha Mandir in Canada, involving sticks and pro-Khalistani flags. Canadian PM Trudeau and opposition leaders denounce the violence, stressing the importance of religious safety. Investigations continue amid rising concerns over Khalistani influence.
title: Trudeau govt under fire over violence outside Brampton temple in Canada

description: The Jammu and Kashmir assembly elected Abdul Rahim Rather of the National Conference as its speaker in the first session after six years. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and protem speaker Mubarak Gul congratulated Rather. The session will end on November 8, and key discussions include the L-G's address and a Motion of Thanks.
title: J&K first assembly session in 6 years: Abdul Rahim Rather elected speaker

description: Shein and Temu, Chinese e-commerce giants, challenge Amazon in the US and Zara and H&M in Europe with low prices and fast turnover. Temu faces a European Union investigation for potential violations of the Digital Services Act, including consumer protection and data privacy concerns. The company risks significant fines if found in breach.
title: Chinese online shopping giant that has become 'headache' for Zara, H&M in trouble

description: India endured a 26-run defeat in the third Test against New Zealand at Wankhede Stadium, completing a 0-3 series whitewash. Captain Rohit Sharma matched MAK Pataudi's record for most home Test losses in a calendar year, with four in 2024. India's next challenge is the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in Australia.
title: First in 55 years, Rohit Sharma joins an 'unwanted' list

description: Captain Rohit Sharma emphasizes the importance of India's mental preparedness for the challenging tour of Australia after a 0-3 home series whitewash by New Zealand. With the first Test approaching, he stresses creating a supportive environment for young players and plans intensive practice sessions to adapt to Australian conditions.
title: Australia is going to be a different ball game: Rohit Sharma

description: At least 20 people have died and many others are injured after a bus fell into a 200-metre deep gorge in Uttarakhand's Almora district. Emergency responders have initiated search and rescue operations. Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has conveyed his condolences and directed swift relief efforts for the victims.
title: At least 20 dead after bus falls into gorge in Uttarakhand's Almora

description: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan announced he has quit smoking after years of heavy consumption. Celebrating his 59th birthday, he shared feeling unexpectedly breathless despite quitting. This is a normal part of the body's healing as damaged lungs and cilia repair. Nicotine withdrawal also plays a role, but these effects are generally temporary, improving with time.
title: Shah Rukh Khan reveals feeling breathless after quitting smoking, know why

description: India captain Rohit Sharma's performance in the current home Test season has been disappointing, scoring only 133 runs in five matches. Dinesh Karthik suggests that Rohit's reliance on aggressive play, rather than trusting his technique, has contributed to his struggles. India suffered a historic 0-3 series loss against New Zealand.
title: Rohit Sharma's 'safe space' in Tests putting him at risk

description: Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' with an AQI of 320, nearing 'severe.' Anand Vihar registers the highest AQI at 433. CPCB data indicates deteriorating condition, with air quality expected to stay similar till Wednesday. IMD forecasts mist or smog during this period, impacting visibility and health.
title: Smog alert: Delhi’s air quality index hits 433 in Anand Vihar

description: A controversial advertisement for Kamala Harris's campaign features a woman voting secretly for Harris despite her husband's belief she supports Trump. Narrated by Julia Roberts, it underscores the privacy of voting. The ad has drawn sharp criticism from Trump supporters, labeling it deceitful. It highlights the crucial battle for votes in the upcoming election, with Harris focusing on mobilizing women voters amid a significant gender gap.
title: 'Can you imagine a wife not telling her husband': Trump camp attacks Harris for ad

description: Indian Railways plans a 'super app' by December to integrate ticket booking, platform passes, and train schedules into one platform. Developed by CRIS and integrated with IRCTC systems, the app aims to streamline services and enhance revenue, while IRCTC maintains a dominant role in online ticket reservations.
title: Soon book Indian Railways tickets, track trains on just one app

description: Mandal Murmu, who signed Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's nomination, joined the BJP, pledging to address demographic changes in Santhal Pargana. This move, seen as receiving blessings from historical leaders Sidhu-Kanhu and Phulo Jhano, reflects concerns over tribal culture erosion and Bangladeshi infiltration. Jharkhand Assembly elections are scheduled for November 13 and 20.
title: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's 'proposer' Mandal Murmu joins BJP

description: Police in Thrissur have filed a case against Union minister Suresh Gopi for traveling in an ambulance to the Thrissur Pooram venue, alleging disruption of the festival. The FIR includes charges under multiple IPC and MV Act sections. CPI functionary K B Sumesh lodged the complaint, while CPI's V S Sunilkumar critiqued Gopi's conflicting statements.
title: Union minister Suresh Gopi booked in Kerala for ‘misusing’ ambulance

description: India's loss to New Zealand has put pressure on the team ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. Former India pacer Karsan Ghavri highlights Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's poor form, stressing the need for experienced players. In an exclusive chat with TimesofIndia.com, Ghavri speaks about Rohit and Virat, India's struggle against, upcoming series vs Australia and more.
title: 'Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma should retire if... '

description: Two minors were apprehended after a hit-and-drag incident involving Delhi Traffic Police officers. The offenders attempted to flee by running a red light and carried two officers on their car's bonnet for 20 meters. The incident occurred in Kishangarh, and the injured officers were taken to the hospital. The Maruti Fronx involved has been recovered.
title: Two Delhi traffic cops dragged on car bonnet; 2 teens held

description: India condemned the violence outside the Hindu Sabha Mandir in Brampton by pro-Khalistani groups, urging Canada for better security measures for consular events. Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and opposition MP Chandra Arya also criticized the extremism, while the Ontario Sikhs and Gurdwara Council called for a thorough investigation.
title: 'Deeply disturbing': India condemns violence outside temple in Canada

description: A minister in Pakistan’s Punjab government, Marriyum Aurangzeb, attributes Lahore's worsening AQI to polluted winds from Indian cities like Amritsar and Chandigarh and proposes dialogue with India to address this issue. She suggests that cooperation between both nations is essential to improve air quality.
title: Pakistan blames winds from Amritsar, Chandigarh for poor AQI in Lahore

description: Reza Valizadeh, an Iranian-American journalist formerly with Radio Farda, has been detained in Iran for months. The US State Department confirmed his arrest amid tensions marking the 45th anniversary of the American Embassy takeover. Valizadeh, held in Evin prison, faces proceedings in Iran's Revolutionary Court, known for its secretive process. The US is seeking more information through Swiss partners.
title: Iran detains Iranian-American journalist amid escalating tension

description: India faced a crushing 0-3 series defeat to New Zealand in the Test series at home, primarily due to their inability to tackle spin on turning pitches. Former opener Aakash Chopra criticized Indian batsmen for lacking confidence against spin and highlighted their lack of domestic cricket practice. Star players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma continued their poor form.
title: 'We can't play spin, period': Ex-India batsman reveals harsh truth
Mount Laki-Laki volcano erupts in Indonesia; 9 killed

description: In the remote Spiti Valley, artist Nawang Tanke brings vibrant murals to schools, monasteries, and cafes, revitalizing the area amidst declining local populations and struggling government services. Tanke's art highlights native wildlife conservation and aims to inspire local youth. As part of AkzoNobel's 'Let's Colour' campaign, these initiatives boost tourism and preserve cultural heritage.
title: Vivid mural campaign injects dose of colour into Spiti Valley

description: Karuppi, a dog from the film 'Pariyerum Perumal', was fatally hit by a bus on Diwali after running outside due to firecracker noise. The incident mirrors her role in the movie where she is a victim of circumstances. Animal activists highlight the repeated pleas to minimize noise levels during festivals to prevent such tragedies.
title: Diwali noise leads to death of canine filmstar in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli

description: Gurugram Police has registered a case against gangster Anmol Bishnoi for allegedly threatening Bhim Sena chief Satpal Tanwar. Anmol made threatening calls from abroad using numbers from Zimbabwe and Kenya. Efforts are underway to bring him back to India. Anmol is currently hiding in the US, with a Rs 10 lakh reward for information leading to his capture.
title: Case against Lawrence Bishnoi's brother Anmol over death threats to Bhim Sena chief

description: In Chhindwara district, two youths tortured a 14-year-old boy and his friend, accusing them of stealing a watch. They were hung upside down, beaten, and burned with chilli-infused embers. Onlookers filmed the incident instead of helping. Following a viral video, the victim's father lodged a police complaint, leading to an investigation against the accused.
title: Teen hung upside down, tortured in MP's Chhindwara on suspicion of stealing watch

description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren rebukes BJP for accusing his party of aiding Bangladeshi infiltrators, questioning the central government's decision to grant asylum to former Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina. Soren claims BJP leaders themselves acknowledge infiltration through BJP-ruled states, and accuses the BJP of divisive and capitalist policies.
title: Hemant Soren hits back at Amit Shah's infiltration claims with Sheikh Hasina jibe

description: India's 0-3 home series defeat to New Zealand has dropped them to second place in the World Test Championship standings. Australia's victory propels them to the top. India must now win four of their remaining five matches in Australia to secure their WTC final spot. In the current WTC cycle, India's fifth defeat led to a substantial reduction in their points percentage (PCT), declining from 62.82 to 58.33. This drop positioned India behind Australia, who reclaimed the top position with a PCT of 62.50.
title: Road to WTC Final: What India must do in BGT

description: BJP's manifesto for Jharkhand polls, emphasized by Home Minister Amit Shah, focuses on countering infiltration and preventing tribal consolidation in favor of CM Hemant Soren. The manifesto highlights themes of 'land, daughter, bread', and promises to address displacement, exam paper leaks, and implement the Uniform Civil Code with tribal exemptions.
title: BJP manifesto a bid to wean tribal voters from JMM

description: The article provides horoscopes for individuals based on their birthdates, detailing the day's potential challenges and opportunities. Key themes include decisive action, patience, intellectual growth, financial caution, spontaneity, balancing responsibilities, introspection, handling personal dynamics, and staying true to one's beliefs while navigating differing viewpoints.
title: Numerology predictions November 4: Read your personalized forecast

description: Gold is anticipated to yield 15-18% returns in Samvat year 2081, driven by positive economic factors and demand. This follows a 30% return in the previous Samvat year due to geopolitical tensions and monetary policy shifts. Import duty trends and interest rate stability may influence gains.
title: 'Gold to shine in new Samvat year too, with up to 18% gain'

description: Chennai Super Kings have retained five crucial players, including captain Ruturaj Gaikwad and veteran MS Dhoni, for the IPL 2025, despite missing the playoffs last season. Ravindra Jadeja, Matheesha Pathirana, and Shivam Dube are also retained. Each franchise was allowed to keep up to six players for the upcoming auction. October 31 marked the final date for all ten IPL teams to finalise their retention lists.
title: 'The Lion Legacy': CSK's post on Dhoni and Ruturaj

description: The Madhya Pradesh administration has significantly increased compensation for victims of wild animal attacks from Rs 8 lakh to Rs 25 lakh, following recent fatalities caused by an elephant in Umaria district near Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve. The tragic incidents occurred in Devra and Brahe villages, resulting in two deaths and one injury.
title: Madhya Pradesh increases death compensation in wild animal attack to Rs 25 lakh

description: India's cricket team faces a transition period with key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli struggling for form. Domestic talents like B Sai Sudharsan, Devdutt Padikkal, Mukesh Kumar, and Washington Sundar provide hope. Tough decisions await as India prepares for challenging overseas tours, beginning with a white-ball series in South Africa.
title: Team India down and under ahead of Australia sojourn

description: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau denounced the attack on the Hindu Sabha temple in Brampton by suspected Khalistani extremists, emphasizing the right of all Canadians to practice their faith safely. Opposition leaders also condemned the violence, while MP Chandra Arya expressed concerns about extremist influences in Canadian institutions.
title: 'Violence at Brampton mandir unacceptable': Trudeau says Canadians have religious freedom

description: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3', starring Kartik Aaryan, achieved a historic milestone by grossing Rs 100 crore in its opening weekend, making it the actor's biggest debut. Despite competing with 'Singham Again', the film earned Rs 106 crore within three days. It also performed well in North America, with $2 million in its opening weekend, and will face more competition soon.
title: Kartik Aaryan scores his first Rs 100 crore opening weekend with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3

description: Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar appealed to Baramati voters to support him in the upcoming assembly polls, referencing their previous support for Sharad Pawar in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Ajit highlighted his efforts in ensuring water supply for Baramati, despite bypassing rules, and emphasized his commitment to the constituency's development.
title: You made 'saheb'You made 'saheb' happy in LS poll, now vote for me, Ajit urges voters happy in Lok Sabha poll, now vote for me, Ajit Pawar urges voters

description: Singham Again records Rs 121 crore in the span of three days. Meanwhile, 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' which also released on the same day has made Rs 106 crore over the opening weekend. Both the films have done well and given a tough competition to each other at the box office.
title: The Ajay Devgn starrer 'Singham Again' sees a drop on Sunday

description: Moises Caicedo's goal denied Manchester United a win, resulting in a 1-1 draw against Chelsea at Old Trafford. Interim boss Ruud van Nistelrooy celebrated Bruno Fernandes' penalty, but United remain 13th in the table. The match highlighted ongoing issues for United, set to see Ruben Amorim as their new manager soon.
title: Manchester United off to worst Premier League start after Chelsea draw

description: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's poor form continues as India suffered a humiliating 3-0 whitewash in the home Test series against New Zealand. Both players are criticized for their batting failures and advised to play domestic cricket before the Border Gavaskar Trophy in Australia, which begins on November 22 in Perth.
title: 'Babar ke baad, Rohit aur Virat ki same situation'

description: Foreign investors sold Rs 94,000 crore in Indian stocks in October, the largest monthly outflow ever, driven by elevated valuations in India and attractive prices in China. This caused key indices to fall by up to 8%. Experts cite slow corporate earnings growth and emphasize focus on stock-specific investments with good Q2 results and earnings visibility.
title: FPIs sell Rs 94,000 crore stocks in October, worst monthly outflow

description: Microsoft India President Puneet Chandok is optimistic about AI's future in India, highlighting the increasing adoption of tools like Copilot across industries. Emphasizing responsible AI practices, he underscores data privacy, transparency, and security. India is a key growth region, with a vast tech talent pool and robust startup ecosystem poised to make significant global impacts.
title: Microsoft India head: It is job number one ..., above everything else

description: Nvidia is set to join the Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing Intel, reflecting Nvidia's critical role in AI technology. This shift highlights Nvidia's impressive stock performance and underscores the DJIA's modernization efforts to better represent the American economy, emphasizing the importance of tech giants.
title: Nvidia is replacing Intel in this 128-year-old Index

description: Six militants from Kangleipak Communist Party and PREPAK (PRO) were arrested in Manipur's Thoubal and Bishnupur districts for alleged abductions and extortion. Two hand grenades and demand letters were seized. Villagers opposed the extortion attempts during ethnic clashes. The arrests highlight the severity of the extortion activities and the presence of explosives.
title: 6 militants arrested in Manipur for extortion

description: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi stresses the importance of protecting the Constitution, highlighting its creation by those who fought for India's freedom with love, not anger. Speaking in Wayanad, he praises his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's compassion and criticizes PM Modi's government for favoring big businessmen and spreading division.
title: Protecting Constitution is India's primary battle: Rahul

description: India successfully intervenes at COP16 in Cali to ensure national laws are respected in a new global mechanism for sharing benefits from digital genetic information. Although the summit made progress, it failed to reach a consensus on establishing a new global biodiversity fund due to a lack of quorum.
title: Consensus eludes COP16 on creating new biodiversity fund

description: Surrendered Naxal cadres in Telangana, including ex-CPI (M) member Saralamma, express frustration over unfulfilled government promises, particularly the denial of agricultural land. Despite receiving initial reward money, many, like Venkatesham, struggle to secure promised support and are forced into menial jobs. Officials attribute challenges to land scarcity and the dissolution of the assignment committee.
title: Let down by government: Surrendered Reds rue 'raw deal'

description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren criticized Union home minister Amit Shah's election promises, questioning BJP's handling of Bangladeshi infiltrators and accusing the central government of failing in job creation. Soren rejected Shah's pledge of a Uniform Civil Code and defended his administration's efforts on exam integrity and tribal land rights. JMM highlighted unmet promises and security lapses in BJP-governed states.
title: Soren counters BJP, says there won't be any UCC in Jharkhand

description: India's 0-3 whitewash against New Zealand in a home Test series marks a historic low. Tactics of head coach Gautam Gambhir, previously successful in IPL, are facing criticism. Critics like former Pakistan batsman Basit Ali highlight the reliance on turning tracks and call for a focus on proper Test match planning for upcoming series in Australia.
title: 'Aaj India ko Rahul Dravid ki yaad aa rahi hogi'

description: Apple CEO Tim Cook isn't familiar with all iPhone features, as shown in an interview where he didn’t know about group chat naming. He later adopted the advice. Despite Apple joining trends late, Cook emphasizes their four-word philosophy: 'Not first, but best,' prioritizing quality over speed in their products.
title: When Apple CEO looked as if has been asked to recommend an Android phone

description: In Boorugupadu village, 45 ST-Koya students now attend a newly renovated school, thanks to local police's efforts. Previously, poor conditions deterred attendance. The initiative, led by teacher Savaralam Veeraswamy and police officer A Raju Varma, aims to improve education in Maoist-affected areas, emphasizing better living conditions.
title: Telangana cops give school in Maoist-hit tribal belt a makeover

description: Bowenpally police have registered a case against four teenagers, including two minors, for setting off firecrackers on a bust of Mahatma Gandhi in Bapuji Nagar. This action followed viral videos of the incident on social media. The teenagers have been detained, and further investigation is ongoing.
title: On cam: Four detained for damaging Mahatma Gandhi’s bust with crackers in Hyderabad
